data.title: Improve terminal link detection July plan item
data.body:
Some improvements for the terminal's link detection:

- [ ] Multi-line links https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/28746
- [ ] Support folders (could open folder in the explorer) #29499
- [ ] Proper link parser https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/583
  - [ ] Unicode/styled links https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/654
  - [ ] Detecting whether `()` are within links https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/583
  - [ ] Improve hostname/TLD support https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/653, https://github.com/sourcelair/xterm.js/issues/601

data.title: Show unsaved file modifications by opening a diff view
data.body:
The feature requested in #358.

The diff view can be opened from the context menu of the open editors items.

data.title: Iteration Plan for July 2017
data.body:
This plan captures our work in July. This is a 5 week iteration. We will ship early August. The main focus remains the same as last iteration's: We continue pushing on #396 "Multi-folder workspaces".

In July and August our team will operate with slightly reduced capacity. Being on the northern hemisphere means summer is upon us. At any given time, a few of us will be busy recharging with friends and families. If you mention somebody in an issue and you don't hear anything for a couple of days, just picture them hanging out on the beach :swimming_woman: :swimming_man: :beach_umbrella:

## Endgame
- *July26nd*: Code freeze for the Zurich endgame
- *July 31st*: Code freeze for the Redmond & Zurich endgame
- *August 4th*: Endgame done

The endgame details for this iteration are tracked in #31333

## Plan Items

Below is a summary of the top level plan items.

Legend of annotations:

| Mark | Description |
| ------------- | ------------- |
| :runner: | work in progress  |
| :hand: | blocked task |
| :muscle: | stretch goal for this iteration  |
| :large_blue_circle: | needs more discussion |
| :red_circle: | missing issue reference |


### Workbench
- [ ] :runner: Multi-folder workspaces #28344 (feature request #396) @bpasero @tyriar **@** **team**
- [x] Improve usability of text search in multi-folder workspaces #29977 #27226 @roblourens
- [x] Allow users to manage custom sections in the explorer (reorder, show/hide) #30120 @sandy081
- [x] Polish Tasks v2.0 [See query.](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+assignee%3Adbaeumer+milestone%3A%22July+2017%22+label%3Atasks) @dbaeumer
- [x] Provide color picker #28587 @michelkaporin @joaomoreno

### Editor
- [x] Polish indentation of lines #28658 @rebornix
- [x] Support for choices in snippets @jrieken
- [x] Improve handling of large files (memory usage, tune max size heuristic) #30180 @alexandrudima
- [x] Make diffs prettier #30087 #23636 #11657 @alexandrudima

### Accessibility
- [ ] :runner: Improve support for assistive technologies in the integrated terminal #8339 @tyriar

### Debug
- [x] Make debug launching multi-folder-workspace aware #29245 @isidorn @weinand 
- [x] Make Debug API multi-folder-workspace aware #31202 @weinand @isidorn 
- [x] Expand API for extensions (`sessionStarted`, `sessionTerminated`, `sendCustomRequest`, `handleCustomEvent`) #30338 @weinand
- [x] Show loaded scripts in a custom explorer section #28521 @weinand
- [x] Support to contribute sections to the debug viewlet @sandy081

### Install/update
- [x] Help users to switch from the Windows 32bit install to the Windows 64-bit install @joaomoreno
- [x] Improve proxy support, support proxies requiring authentication #22214 @joaomoreno

### SCM
- [ ] :muscle: :runner: :red_circle: Support for multiple repositories in a workspace @joaomoreno
- [x] Revive creating a branch on checkout from status bar #21439 @joaomoreno 

### Integrated Terminal
- [x] Quick pick to navigate to a particular terminal #29879 @lixire

### Languages

##### Language Server Protocol
- [x] Maintenance, answer questions, clarify protocol as needed @dbaeumer

##### JavaScript/TypeScript
- [x] Support multi-folder workspaces #30414 @mjbvz
- [x] Explore how to support external files supported by TS server plug-ins #30411 @mjbvz
- [x] Explore watch mode for TS build task #29580 @mjbvz

#### ESLint
- [x]  Explore the eslint language server supporting multi-folder workspaces @dbaeumer

##### CSS
- [x] Explore moving Emmet css completion provider into the css LS #29113 @ramya-rao-a 

##### Emmet
- [x] Support custom snippets in new Emmet #29146
- [x] Collaborate on Emmet fixes @ramya-rao-a https://github.com/emmetio/atom-plugin/issues/30, https://github.com/emmetio/atom-plugin/issues/23, https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/30078, https://github.com/emmetio/abbreviation/pull/3 and https://github.com/emmetio/abbreviation/pull/2, https://github.com/emmetio/html-transform/pull/1
- [x] Increase test coverage for Emmet #8454 @ramya-rao-a
- [x]  Implement remaining 2 emmet actions: Update Image Size (#27977) and Reflect CSS Value (#31298)
- [x] Prepare Emmet extension for translation #29969 @ramya-rao-a

### Extensions

##### API
- [x] Experiment: remote file system #30337 @jrieken

### Engineering items
- [x] Adopt TS 2.4.1 in vscode and team-supported extensions #28643 @mjbvz **@** **team**
- [x] Improve automated support for issue labeling and assignment #26223 @chrmarti
- [x] Startup performance: use V8 snapshots for the VS Code loader #28492 @jrieken 

### Documentation
- [ ] :runner: Recipe using Tasks with webpack, starting, problem matchers (see also #29619) @aefernandes @lixire

### Exploration
- [x] Explore the idea of a task panel @lixire @aefernandes
- [ ] :runner:  Analysis of current test runner extensions (see also #9505) @aefernandes 
- [x] Investigate into adding a secure credential storage API #15414 @chrmarti

## Deferred
- New release of the Monaco Editor https://github.com/Microsoft/monaco-editor/issues/510 @rebornix
- :runner: Adopt Electron `1.7.4` #28582  @tyriar
- :runner: Use inspector protocol for extension debugging Microsoft/vscode-node-debug2#4 @roblourens
- Support commands in the hover #29076 @jrieken
- Enable electron crash reporter for all processes #21944 @ramya-rao-a
- Explore how best to help HTMLHint @ramya-rao-a
- Improve selection drawing #29042 @tyriar
- Improve link detection #30211 @tyriar

data.title: High CPU load on MacOS
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (5df9a157abe3243af639f8c1b9503f1b5e7a4a95, 2017-07-04T16:02:32.957Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: none
(1 theme extensions excluded)
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a git repo 
2. Edit Text

This was happening to me with the non-insider build as well. CPU usage is consistently over 70% and spikes to as high as 200%,  as reported by Activity Manager. A sample of the offending process is below.

Reproduces without extensions: Yes
[Sample of Code - Insiders Helper.txt](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/1129144/Sample.of.Code.-.Insiders.Helper.txt)

data.title: vscode.TaskGroup.Test should be Test, not Clean
data.body:
This should help resolve a minor bug

Also, should VSCode also support a "Run" task by default? We imply a build when you perform "test" in our own command-line tools, I'm not sure if this is the intended behavior of the VSCode "Test" group, or if its meant to run only?

Thanks!

data.title: "Load More Stack Frames" blinks while stepping
data.body:
- Hit breakpoint in code with more than 20 or so frames
- Step
- See the callstack stable except for the "Load More" button. If the rest of the callstack is stable, it would look better if the "Load More" button can be stable too.

![jul-06-2017 11-20-47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/323878/27926418-392ab7a2-623d-11e7-9919-359e5a2d4a0e.gif)

data.title: JavaScript Intellisense not working
Inline debug values still visible after debug session
data.body:
- Start debugging with `"debug.inlineValues": true`
- Stop debugging (while paused?)
- Inline value decorations are still present

I can't repro it consistently but I've seen it a few times in the past couple days. Let me know how I can help debug, if you don't see it. They go away when I ctrl+tab switch editors.

data.body:

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.13.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. enable block cursor
2. enable some syntax with bold or italic characters and add some
3. position over a character which is bold or italic
4. note that the character under the cursor is neither bold nor italic

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Markdown preview - show tooltip on links
data.body: Would be great to see a tooltip on links, showing the target. Or popping it up in the status bar or elsewhere, like Chrome.

data.title: Feature Request : Eclipse style file syntax check status highlighting in the file menu bar
data.body:
For angular2 projects which contain numerous typescript files, a module/class/function name mismatch in one file causes problems in the dependent files (often during code refactoring).
As of now, VScode highlights the error in the dependent file with a red underline on the imported variable name. Instead of manually going through all the dependent files, it would be nice if VSC can highlight the files which have problems ( like broken file icon in file list menu in eclipse ). 

VScode version : 1.13.1

data.title: TypeScript: references/rename does not work for properties in JSDoc comments
data.body:
Using TypeScript is `checkJs` mode, when an identifier is selected inside a JSDoc comment

- the references are not highlighted
- "find references" and "rename" fail to work

You can see the absence of highlighted references in this example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/921609/27917793-fc13a810-6264-11e7-9f65-c2648caba89b.png)

You can verify the JSDoc comment is "doing something" by checking the type flows through:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/921609/27917817-09ca3ae6-6265-11e7-85f0-4696c273c03a.png)

data.title: Running in WSL (yes I know it's not official)
data.body:
I'm aware this is not supported yet but obviously a lot of work has been done around it so I thought I'd raise this as it's SOOOO close now! With dbus and various other issues out of the way, the only remaining fatal issue seems to be the check failed issue shown below.

- VSCode Version:  1-14-0.insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 with creators update. (I'll try again with the preview build this evening)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VcXsrv and configure to use single screen using XLaunch.
2. Open "Bash on Ubuntu on Windows"
3.  execute `LIBGL_ALWAYS_INDIRECT=1 DISPLAY=:0 code-insiders --verbose`

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Stack: 
```
[4533:0706/153512.810904:WARNING:audio_manager.cc(317)] Multiple instances of AudioManager detected
[4533:0706/153512.810991:WARNING:audio_manager.cc(278)] Multiple instances of AudioManager detected
[4533:0706/153512.815020:FATAL:udev_linux.cc(20)] Check failed: monitor_.
#0 0x000001af7a0e <unknown>
#1 0x000001adccab <unknown>
#2 0x00000277b426 <unknown>
#3 0x000001a4118b <unknown>
#4 0x000001ae010e <unknown>
#5 0x000001b332ac <unknown>
#6 0x000001b33558 <unknown>
#7 0x000001b338bb <unknown>
#8 0x000001ae2469 <unknown>
#9 0x000001b33047 <unknown>
#10 0x000001b15460 <unknown>
#11 0x000002561126 <unknown>
#12 0x0000025612d9 <unknown>
#13 0x000001b4b165 <unknown>
#14 0x000001b25693 <unknown>
#15 0x7f36524576ba start_thread
#16 0x7f364b9673dd clone
```


Using the default powershell works fine.

data.title: Feature Request: Change Vertical Scrollbar Width
data.body:
Is there any way to change the width of the vertical scrollbars in Visual Studio Code, especially the one for the left panel?

I find it so thin that it's a bit fiddly to use.

data.title: SCSS:  Incorrect syntax coloring in complex nested rule
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (767eea03270f924b27d363a97dded3aff9f9e92a, 2017-07-05T18:51:17.228Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.9.1
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
project-manager|ale|0.18.1
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7
tslint|eg2|0.16.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
Angular2|joh|2.3.3
ecdc|mit|0.10.3
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.0.0
vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.4.1
angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17
stylelint|shi|0.26.0
ayu|tea|0.4.0
change-case|wma|1.0.0

(4 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In this code snippet:

````scss
a {
  &:not(.collapsed)::after {
    @include chevron-opened;
  }

  &::after {
    @include chevron-closed;
  }
}
````

The first `after` and `@include chevron-opened` are not correctly colored, although the second ones are.

![screen shot 2017-07-06 at 10 22 58 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835148/27915749-20ac9cde-6235-11e7-95fc-97ed135306b0.png)


Using the scope inspector confirms that the first ones are not correctly scoped.

You can see that even Github syntax coloring has it correctly.

data.title: `value` leaks inside closure inside closure inside closure
data.body: * when opening a huge file * after the file is finished loading, do a heap snapshot * look for the largest retained arrays * the huge file is leaked in a closure scope here: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c0cd610e56c55d6a42060e11a99a4dc6eae7c6e8/src/vs/workbench/services/textfile/common/textFileEditorModel.ts#L448 The listener is alive for the lifetime of the model, and somehow manages to capture `value`, which is the initial text content of the model. fyi @bpasero @Tyriar -- I will detangle the closures to avoid capturing `value` in the listener.

data.title: Emmet 2.0:  auto-completion stops intermittently
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.14.0-insider (767eea03270f924b27d363a97dded3aff9f9e92a, 2017-07-05T18:51:17.228Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.6.0
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
ng-template|Ang|0.1.4
vscode-markdownlint|Dav|0.9.1
code-settings-sync|Sha|2.8.2
sort-lines|Tyr|1.3.0
Bookmarks|ale|0.15.2
project-manager|ale|0.18.1
path-intellisense|chr|1.4.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.2.11
vscode-html-css|ecm|0.1.7
tslint|eg2|0.16.0
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
Angular2|joh|2.3.3
ecdc|mit|0.10.3
HTMLHint|mka|0.3.3
vscode-autoprefixer|mrm|2.0.0
vscode-stylefmt|mrm|2.4.1
angular2-inline|nat|0.0.17
stylelint|shi|0.26.0
ayu|tea|0.4.0
change-case|wma|1.0.0

(4 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

One of  the most convenient things about Emmet was  the "fuzzy logic" for choosing the most likely abbreviation.  This seems to be not working.

1. In an scss file, inside a rule type `mb0`,  For example:

````
.myrule {
   padding: 0;
    mb10
}
````
2. This should expand to `margin-bottom: 10px`, but it does nothing.

As an aside, if I just type the `mb` part, I get intellisense for many things, apparently by searching for `m` and `b`.  The most common completion, `margin-bottom` is not at the top.

This has slowed down my coding, as I have grown used to the Emmet shortcuts for css like`mb10` or `m0-5-5`.

data.title: php extract method from selection - feature request
data.body:
It would be really nice to have a PHP extract method from selection, like PHP Storm has. It is a very useful refactoring tool.

here is an example: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MhwE52kdylI

But LSP doesn't have any method for this (and VS Code also has no UI for it). That would need to be added first before the language server can implement it.
